meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be cast.
meanings.sent1: The castabilities of the metal made it perfect for creating intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor admired the castabilities of the clay, envisioning beautiful sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The castabilities of the rubber duck made it a star in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination had castabilities that knew no bounds, creating endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The castabilities of the sand allowed the artist to mold it into stunning shapes.

meanings.sent1: The director saw great castabilities in the talented actors auditioning for the lead role.
meanings.sent2: The casting agent recognized the castabilities of the aspiring actress, offering her a role in the film.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat had such incredible castabilities that it seemed to produce endless rabbits.
meanings.sent4: The castabilities of the fishing line were so strong that it could reel in the biggest catch.
meanings.sent5: The chef marveled at the castabilities of the chocolate, imagining all the delicious desserts he could create.
